required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Surveillance of Treatment of Children With Growth Hormone Deficiency With Zomacton®
clinical_study.official_title: Non-interventional, Observational Study of the Application of Zomacton® in the Treatment of Growth Hormone Deficiency in Routine Clinical Practice

oversight_info.authority: Czech Republic: State Institute for Drug Control

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the long-term treatment with Zomacton® for pituitary short stature in children with insufficient growth hormone production and/or short stature caused by Turner's syndrome.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of Zomacton® treatment measured by the increase in body height per annuum

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of Zomacton® treatment measured by the increase in body weight per annuum
Safety of Zomacton® and the application device measured by local adverse reactions to the application device

arm_group.description: Children with growth hormone deficiency treated with somatropin as Zomacton® according to the marketing authorization

intervention.description: Somatropin powder and solvent for solution for injection

study_pop.textblock: Children with inadequate secretion of growth-hormone; growth retardation due to Turner's syndrome

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- therapeutic need according to the approved specific products characteristics (SPC)
Exclusion Criteria:
- contraindication according to the SPC
